metadata.name: Job
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job
metadata.description:
Job

Represents a generic Job that may be performed on a Table.

The subclasses of Job represent the specific BigQuery job types: CopyJob, ExtractJob, LoadJob, and QueryJob.

A job instance is created when you call Project#query_job, Dataset#query_job, Table#copy, Table#extract, Table#load, or View#data.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery

q = "SELECT COUNT(word) as count FROM publicdata:samples.shakespeare"
job = bigquery.query_job q

job.wait_until_done!

if job.failed?
  puts job.error
else
  puts job.query_results.first
end

metadata.name: project_id
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#project_id
metadata.description: The ID of the project containing the job.

metadata.name: state
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#state
metadata.description: The current state of the job. The possible values are PENDING, RUNNING, and DONE. A DONE state does not mean that the job completed successfully. Use #failed? to discover if an error occurred or if the job was successful.

metadata.name: done?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#done?
metadata.description: Checks if the job’s state is DONE. When true, the job has stopped running. However, a DONE state does not mean that the job completed successfully. Use #failed? to detect if an error occurred or if the job was successful.

metadata.name: created_at
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#created_at
metadata.description: The time when the job was created.

metadata.name: started_at
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#started_at
metadata.description: The time when the job was started. This field is present after the job’s state changes from PENDING to either RUNNING or DONE.

metadata.name: ended_at
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#ended_at
metadata.description: The time when the job ended. This field is present when the job’s state is DONE.

metadata.name: configuration
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#configuration
metadata.description: The configuration for the job. Returns a hash.

metadata.name: statistics
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#statistics
metadata.description: The statistics for the job. Returns a hash.

metadata.name: status
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#status
metadata.description: The job’s status. Returns a hash. The values contained in the hash are also exposed by #state, #error, and #errors.

metadata.name: error
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#error
metadata.description: The last error for the job, if any errors have occurred. Returns a hash.

metadata.name: errors
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#errors
metadata.description: The errors for the job, if any errors have occurred. Returns an array of hash objects. See #error.

metadata.name: rerun!
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#rerun!
metadata.description: Created a new job with the current configuration.

metadata.name: reload!
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#reload!
metadata.description: Reloads the job with current data from the BigQuery service.

metadata.name: wait_until_done!
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
Job#wait_until_done!
metadata.description: Refreshes the job until the job is DONE. The delay between refreshes will incrementally increase.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

extract_job = table.extract "gs://my-bucket/file-name.json",
                            format: "json"
extract_job.wait_until_done!
extract_job.done? #=> true
